Intro.title: What is about.js?
Intro.subtitle: Tech blog about:
Intro.introduction: ðŸ‘‹ My name is Greg and I am here to help you to keep up with the fresh news from JS land.

AboutAuthor.title: About me
AboutAuthor.bio: I love creating new things through coding. I have always been a builder. From building LEGO blocks in my childhood and being a musician to programming, I have always enjoyed creating something new. I chose JavaScript for the possibility of building isomorphic applications and for having all the building blocks in place, such as frameworks, packages, and other tooling. Initially, I was focused on the frontend, but as my curiosity grew, my interest expanded to the broader ecosystem. I gained robust experience in the modern web dev by working for startup companies. I stay up to date with new technology because of my curiosity and passion for coding. So here I am, ready to share my experience and my journey through software development.

Separator.content: Here is what you will find on this blog

frontend.title: Frontend
frontend.content: Fresh new about frameworks tooling. We all know that a new library pops out every day. If you're looking for news about React, Next.js, Tailwind etc. This blog will keep you informed about React, Next.js, Tailwind, and more...

backend.title: Backend
backend.content: JavaScript has long been more than just a frontend-specific programming language. With Node.js and other backend tools on the belt, you can build modern, robust server-side applications. I'll show you how to do this in practice.

webDevFullstack.title: Web dev Fullstack
webDevFullstack.content: Creating web applications is both a satisfying and exciting process. You can do this entirely within the JavaScript ecosystem. You can choose full-stack meta-frameworks or create the backend and frontend separately. I'd like to show how I take advantage of these possibilities.

webAI.title: Web AI
webAI.content: These days, a lot of effort goes into integrating AI solutions with applications built using JavaScript. I work on such integrations and take great pleasure in it. I am happy to share tips, tricks, and insights about the tools I use.
